  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Step_5_-_Run_BCI_Load,_Part_4</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2016-11-28T21:54:13.000Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Step 5 - Run BCI Load, Part 4</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">This is a multi-step process.  There are 4 separate jobs to be run to accomplish this step.   Each of the 4 separate jobs need to be run for each account type, except ILA.  We don't run this for ILA's on Staging.

The files can be found at /app/dailybatch/bcifiles

To run the job replace '<Bank>' with the bank code: abt, nba, nsb, vbc, zfnb or cbt. Replace <Account Type> with DDASAV_CLOSE, CRL_CLOSE, CDIRA_CLOSE, or COML_CLOSE

Preconditions:
 Steps 1-4 need to be complete (and run successfully) before this step can be run.

Make sure there are no 'sym link' files open in /s1env/shares/zions/s1batch/data before you start. If there are, it means a job is either currently running, or got hung up in a previous run. If they exist from a previous run just delete them.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Step_5_-_Run_BCI_Load,_Part_4" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=49871" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>
  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Step_1_-_Generate_Account_List_files</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2016-11-28T22:05:31.931Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Step 1 - Generate Account List files</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Step 1 generates the Account List files.  These jobs take data from the DB2 database OBBATCH.TMP_ACCTLIST) and translates them into files used in other steps of the batch process.  These jobs are run on Staging only - the test environments are not set up to run these, nor are the servers powerful enough to handle the load.

The affiliates are split up between the two servers as follows:

utaxa214: ABT, NBA, NSB, VBC

utaxa215: ZFNB, CBT

If a job fails with a message:  "WARN [main] (AccountList.java:134) - Today's file differs from yesterday's file by more than configured threshold of 5.0% !"
 You'll need to tweak the .previous file so that it more closely mimicks the .finished file.  To do this find the .finished file, make a copy of it then edit it by removing a few rows.  Finally, rename it as the .previous file, overwriting the existing .previous file. Then, run the job again - it should complete OK.

The files are stored here: /app/dailybatch/s1_batch_processing/finished

To run the job replace '<Bank>' with the bank code: abt, nba, nsb, vbc, zfnb or cbt.  Replace <Account Type> with dda, crl, cdira, coml or ila

Preconditions:
 Access to run scripts with Putty on utaxa214 & utaxa215 is required.  You also need WinSCP so you can view files.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Step_1_-_Generate_Account_List_files" title="" type="application/xml"/>
    <tag0:link rel="enclosure" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/web/console/Mobile%20and%20Online%20Banking%20%28Quality%20Management%29/_tx0jEK39Eead8Oi3qsmIPw#action=com.ibm.rqm.planning.home.actionDispatcher&subAction=viewTestCase&id=49916" title="Web Console" type="text/html"/>

The files can be found at /app/dailybatch/bcifiles

To run the job replace '<Bank>' with the bank code: abt, nba, nsb, vbc, zfnb or cbt. Replace <Account Type> with DDASAV_TRANS, CRL_TRANS, CDIRA_TRANS, or COML_TRANS

Preconditions:
 Steps 1-4 need to be complete (and run successfully) before this step can be run.

Make sure there are no 'sym link' files open in /s1env/shares/zions/s1batch/data before you start. If there are, it means a job is either currently running, or got hung up in a previous run. If they exist from a previous run just delete them.</tag0:summary>

  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Inbound_3rd_Party_Transfer</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2016-11-28T22:05:33.438Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Inbound 3rd Party Transfer</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Aug 27 2015, we found that a number of inbound external transfers wered directed to closed accounts, causing manual GL balancing to be done. This could be prevented by having the inbound transfers be dependent on the memo post job like the outbound transfers. 

This test is to verify that inbound transfers are dependent on the memo post job.</tag0:summary>

Debit Card Overdraft Approval - this was the courtesy approval page.</tag0:summary>

  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Over_Daily_Limit_Outbound_-_Create_Transfer</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2016-11-28T22:05:35.619Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Over Daily Limit Outbound - Create Transfer</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">The UI will not allow a customer to submit an external transfer for an amount that when added to the other transfer of that type scheduled for that same day, will exceed the daily limit for that type of transaction.

Preconditions:
Test client needs to have these limits set up in SAM:

Inbound Daily Limit: $20

Outbound Daily Limit: $10</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2016-11-28T22:05:39.232Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Step 5 - Run BCI Load, Part 1</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">This is a multi-step process.  There are 4 separate jobs to be run to accomplish this step.   Each of the 4 separate jobs need to be run for each account type, except ILA.  We don't run this for ILA's on Staging.

The files can be found at /app/dailybatch/bcifiles

To run the job replace '<Bank>' with the bank code: abt, nba, nsb, vbc, zfnb or cbt. Replace <Account Type> with DDASAV, CRL, CDIRA, or COML

If the job fails do the following before attempting to run again:
Look at the logs/job data to determine why it failed.  Get with a developer to help you find and fix the problem.
Go to /app/dailybatch/bcifiles/<Bank>/<Account Type>.  For each Account Type of each bank you'll see 4 folders: BALS, CLOSE, PRODCODES & TRANS
Open the 'BALPOST' file in each folder for editing
On the first line of each file you'll see a time stamp - change that timestamp value by 1.  For example, if the timestamp is 20150716013516, change it to 20150716013517.  Keep in mind that time stamps roll over to 00 at 59.
Save the file, then move on to the next one
Repeat this process for each bank, account type & folder (BALS, CLOSE, PRODCODES & TRANS) - yeah, it's a pain.
Delete the sym links - see instructions in the Preconditions below.

Preconditions:
 Steps 1-4 need to be complete (and run successfully) before this step can be run.

Make sure there are no 'sym link' files open in /s1env/shares/zions/s1batch/data before you start. If there are, it means a job is either currently running, or got hung up in a previous run.  If they exist from a previous run just delete them.</tag0:summary>

  </tag0:entry>

    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Step_4_-_Run_BCI_Processing</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2016-11-28T22:05:39.525Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Step 4 - Run BCI Processing</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Step 3 takes the Host files (in /app/host_data) and distributes them into the BCI Load directories.  

For this step run the startIBBciProcessing.ksh job for each bank & account type.

To run the job replace '<Bank>' with the bank code: abt, nba, nsb, vbc, zfnb or cbt. Replace <Account Type> with dda, crl, cdira, coml or ila

Preconditions:
 Steps 1, 2 & 3 need to be complete before running this job.  Steps 2 & 3 can be accomplished by having Production files copied into the host_data directories on Staging.

Make sure there are no 'sym link' files open in /s1env/shares/zions/s1batch/data.  If there are, just delete them.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:title type="text">Over Daily Limit Inbound - Create Transfer</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">The UI will not allow a customer to submit an external transfer for an amount that when added to the other transfer of that type scheduled for that same day, will exceed the daily limit for that type of transaction.

Preconditions:
Test client needs to have these limits set up in SAM:

Inbound Daily Limit: $20

Outbound Daily Limit: $10</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:title type="text">Verify external account</tag0:title>

    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Hotlist_check_external_account</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2016-11-28T22:06:07.513Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Hotlist check external account</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">When a customer tries to add an external account that is on the hotlist for all the customers the new account is not added.

 When a customer tries to add an external account that is on the hotlist for their IBN only, the new account is not added.

 Example Hotlist accounts for testing:

 Routing number / Account Number

 122100024 / DDA 753063098

 021272655 / SAV 9342981380</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Hotlist_check_external_account" title="" type="application/xml"/>

  </tag0:entry>
  <tag0:entry>
    <tag0:id>https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/External_account_alert_batch_job</tag0:id>
    <tag0:updated>2016-11-28T22:06:08.640Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">External account alert batch job</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">The ACCTSUBDRALERT batch job will generate and deliver alerts to customer's with unverified external accounts.

 1.  The first alert is sent to their message inbox and email address when the account moves to a Verify status
 2.  The second alert is sent to their message inbox and email address when the account is still In Process and they are half-way to the expiration date
 3.  The third alert is sent to their message inbox and email address when the account expires.</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/External_account_alert_batch_job" title="" type="application/xml"/>

  </tag0:entry>

    <tag0:title type="text">Wires Create Real Time Book Transfer</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Use this test case to verify that a real time Book Transfer wire may be submitted successfully.

Preconditions:
The OLB Customer must be enrolled for Wires.
The OLB Customer must have an eligble funding account
MTS Wire line must be connected and live
User must have a valid recipient
S1 must be set up to allow wires
IB Admin must be set up to allow wires</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2016-11-28T22:06:10.167Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">External account in transfer lists</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">The external account with a status of In Process, Verify, Locked or Expired is not displayed in the transfer source or destination account lists

 The external account with a status of Active is displayed in the transfer source and destination account lists.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2016-11-28T22:06:12.267Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">External Micro Deposit Batch Job</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">ACCTSUBDRXFER batch job

The ACCTSUBDRXFER batch job will generate an ACH file of micro-deposits amounts for In Process external accounts.  Those account's status' will change from In Process to Verify

 

This process needs to be run before 3pm or the accounts will not be processed until the next day.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2016-11-28T22:06:23.781Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">EAP - Transfer, no code required, under limit</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">If a customer is enrolled in EAP and submits a transfer of a type that is enabled, for an amount that is under the threshold for that transfer type, the customer will not be required to submit a code for the transfer to complete.

 This is common code.
 This is valid for POLB an BOLB customers at all banks.

 EAP is used for internal, external and deposit only transfers for POLB customers
 EAP is used for interna and deposit only transfers for BOLB customers.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2016-11-28T22:06:24.021Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">EAP - Auto Enrollment Workflow</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">If an EAP enabled customer that is not enrolled submits a Quick or Create transfer for an amount that is greater than the threshold for that type of transfer, the system will automatically put the customer into the Enrollment workflow.  The customer will be allowed to complete the enrollment without error.

 This is common code.
 This is valid for POLB an BOLB customers at all banks.


 EAP is used for internal, external and deposit only transfers for POLB customers
 EAP is used for internal and deposit only transfers for BOLB customers.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2016-11-28T22:06:28.481Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">2DAY - Internal Xfer Overdraft</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">TWO DAY TEST - Batch process allows internal transfer that will hit Overdraft

If a scheduled internal transfer is for an amount that is greater than the source account's available balance but less than the authorized balance, the ACCTRXFREXEC batch job will process the transfer as if the customer approved the overdraft.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:title type="text">2DAY - Delete Problem Transfer</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">TWO DAY TEST: Deleting problem transfer adjusts the daily cumulative total

When a transfer to a friend with a problem status is deleted, the daily cumulative total for that day is adjusted.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:summary type="text">TWO DAY TEST - Failing recurring internal transfers generate the next occurrence

If a customer's recurring transfer fails to process in the ACCTRXFREXEC batch job, the next occurrence is generated</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:summary type="text">TWO DAY TEST - Scheduled internal transfers are processed by batch -Invalid

    <tag0:updated>2016-11-28T22:06:31.467Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Commerical Loan Advance Relationship</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">The UI will not allow a customer to submit a transfer from a commerical loan where the borrower on that loan does not have one of the following relationships to the destination account
 (Sole Owner, Sole Prop, Prin Owner, Joint Or, Bus DBA, DBA Corporation, LLC, Partnership).



 VBC BOLB 1130000001775161 / dbennett

 Source account is account : Commercial Loans - R - xxxxxxxxxx9001

 If destination is: SMRC - xxxxxx7856 (relationship is LLC) , the advance is allowed.

 If destination is : ARS - xxxxxx8169 (relationship is IB USER), the advance is disallowed


OR 
 Zions BOLB 1010000001276018 / nsponbe 00178416989001 

 Source account is : CLAR63 - 9001 (Borrower is Zap Electric LLC)

 If destination is DDA107 - 7187 (Zap Electric relationship is Prin Owner), the advance is allowed.

 If destination is DDA 107 - 7237 (Zap Electric relationship does not exist, the advance is disallowed.

 If destination is DDA 104 - 7245 (Zap Electric relationship is IB User, the advance is disallowed.

Warning:
This type of transfer is not permitted and was not processed. If you need additional information please contact Customer Service.</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:title type="text">Pre-Cutoff Delivery Date - Quick Transfer</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">Ext Txfrs set to next business day - Before cutoff, Quick

When an external transfer is submitted prior to the affiliate's cutoff time for external tranfsers, the delivery date will be the next business day. 

Cutoff times are configurable in SAM, but most likely they are:
Amegy: 3:00 PM Central time
CBT: 3:00 PM Pacific time
NBA: 3:00 PM Mountain time
NSB: 3:00 PM Pacific time
Vectra: 3:00 PM Mountain time
Zions: 3:00 PM Mountain time</tag0:summary>

    <tag0:updated>2017-08-10T18:10:08.209Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Dis-Allowed Accounts</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">No transfers between external account and loans, cards or friend

The UI will not allow a customer to submit a transfer where one of the accounts is an external account and the other is a credit, loan or friend account.

IE... 
External to Loan
Loan to External
Loan to Friend
Credit Card to Friend
Credit Card to External</tag0:summary>
    <tag0:link rel="alternate" href="https://clm.cs.zionsbank.com/qm/service/com.ibm.rqm.integration.service.IIntegrationService/resources/Mobile+and+Online+Banking+%28Quality+Management%29/testcase/Dis-Allowed_Accounts" title="" type="application/xml"/>

    <tag0:updated>2017-08-10T20:54:01.034Z</tag0:updated>
    <tag0:title type="text">Over Daily Limit Outbound - Quick Transfer</tag0:title>
    <tag0:summary type="text">The UI will not allow a customer to submit an external transfer for an amount that when added to the other transfer of that type scheduled for that same day, will exceed the daily limit for that type of transaction.

Preconditions:
Test client needs to have these limits set up in SAM:

Inbound Daily Limit: $20

Outbound Daily Limit: $10</tag0:summary>
